_attributes: Placed coin orders, counted cash drawers and made a deposit each day / night.
Oversaw the day-to-day running of the theatre in order to run efficiently and to meet profit and patron expectations
Wrote memos regarding new changes / updates to our employee expectations and job descriptions.
Set box office and usher departmental objectives, polices, and procedures.
Opened and closed the theatre as a key holder.
Conducted interviews of new applicants to pass on to final interviews.
Assisted patrons with issues such as seating, age policy, disturbances, and loyalty issues.
Processed refunds of all types to patrons.
Fixed projector, sound, and other building maintenance issues on a daily basis.
Trained new staff members on usher and company policies.
Managed daily usher staff to ensure jobs were being completed in a timely fashion.
Scheduled usher staff to theaters to manage time and efficiency.
Cleaned lobby, hallways, and theaters between shows.
Checked ticket stubs to confirm patrons were at their correct show and directed them to their theatre.
Showed patrons to their seats to eliminate any seating issues.
Checked theaters during shows to confirm they were working properly and solve and issues with patrons
Trained new staff members on how to use the ticket sales system and explained all company rules and procedures
Explained the new seating system to patrons and sold them tickets to their desired showtime
Processed refunds to patrons and performed swaps of tickets
Assisted customers with ticket issues, managing rewards points, and other issues
Cleaned and sanitized video games, front doors, and box office areas daily

_skills._skillDescription: Enjoy writing C# when utilizing .Net Core to write APIs.
Is it a programming language? Is it not? Either way there is no escaping writing it. I am proficient using it with Angular and vanilla JavaScript.
I am a big fan of the relational model and thus a fan of SQL. I have written a lot of SQL from MySQL, AWS RDS, Access, to Salesforce Marketing Cloud.

Though I have never worked with C++ on a industry application. C++ is my language of choice when solving academic computer science problems from data structures, algorithms, to even a little microcontroller programming.
I have done a lot of school projects in Java and even some high school robotics but have no idustry experience yet.
Just like everyone else I have a very special place in my heart for python and have created countless scripts to working with Django to programming IoT lamndas
I have a love for statistical data analysis and how R handles matrices and large data sets with only a few lines of code.
Django is the backend framework that this page is servicing from so depending on how many 500's you're getting is the measure of my skill.
I have a love for statistical data analysis and how R handles matrices and large data sets with only a few lines of code.

From my first job to my last job I have been working in Excel for years. From bookkeeping to data analysis to creating CSVs I know my way around Excel. Even have earned a Microsoft Specialist Certification.
There was a lot of sweat and even more tears when learning to master Linked Lists, Stacks, Queues, Binary Search Trees, AVL Trees, Hash Tables, Heaps, and Graphs

I understand that the definition of algorithm is just a process or a set of rules which is fair but I have spent a lot of time learning and implementing complex algorithms academically and in the industry. So I would like to think it's more complicated.

I love creating software and implementing my thoughts but I have always loved seeing my big picture thoughts on paper in the form of Flowcharts, Class Diagrams, Entity Relationship Diagrams, UML, or Network Diagrams.
